newsitem.title: MALTA: Shares up slightly in Malta trading.
newsitem.headline: Shares up slightly in Malta trading.

text.p: Bank shares were up slightly in the once weekly trading session of the Malta Stock Exchange, held on Friday instead of Wednesday because of a fault in the exchange's electronic trading system.
Market turnover reached just over 480,500 Maltese pounds spread over 125 deals. Of these, 85 were in equities and 40 in fixed income securities. Trading the previous week was 214,500 pounds.

Total equity turnover amounted to just over 182,500 pounds, with 136,501 shares traded. Of these, 94,147 were Bank of Valletta shares, which were traded in 64 deals at an average price of 125.4 cents per share, up from 124.8 cents last week.
At the same time, 17 deals were made in Mid-Med Bank, with 40,100 shares changing hands for an average price of 153.8 cents per share, from 150.2 cents.

In Middle Sea Insurance 2,100 shares were sold for an average 122 cents per share, up one cent. In the government bond market, there were dealings in 14 different issues, with turnover amounting to just under 295,000 pounds. Business was mainly in the 7.5 percent MGS 2011.
In corporate bonds, there was one deal in Mid Med Bank 7.25 percent unsecured loan stock 2005, and another deal in 6.5 percent Gasan bonds 1998/99 amounting to 1,379 and 1,978 pounds respectively.
The share index reached 998.27 from 990.32 the previous week. ($1: 38.7 cents)
